intro: Oldenlandia scabra, commonly known as roughleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically rough to the touch, hence its common name, and are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are usually white or pale blue, with five petals, and bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or coastal areas.
